snippet: There are concerns that the pervasiveness and pressures of social media are contributing factors to a rising suicide rate for children ages 10 to 14....
abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention publishes report that finds suicide rate for children between ages of 10 and 14 is equal to rate at which they die in traffic accidents.

byline.contributor: Jan Hoffman contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: There are concerns that the pervasiveness and pressures of social media are contributing factors to a rising suicide rate for children ages 10 to 14.

headline.main: Young Adolescents as Likely to Die From Suicide as From Traffic Accidents
headline.print_headline: Suicides Outnumber Traffic Deaths for Adolescents

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
